title: Royal christening gowns, and 8 other surprising ways to use a tea bag
text:
It should come as no surprise to anyone that the royal household, in time of need, should turn to Yorkshire tea. Butter comes from Devon, ice cream from Cornwall and tea from Yorkshire, as Betty’s Tearooms and Taylors of Harrogate will testify. It is, as Miss Austen would say, a truth universally acknowledged.

So when Prince George’s sparkling new christening robe needed to be given the air of antiquity that one associates with regal christenings – the old robe was regarded as just too delicate to withstand the athletic font-side manoeuvres of a strapping baby boy, according to Angela Kelly, the Queen’s dressmaker and confidant – any nanny, housemaid or workaday mother would have known to turn...
description: It should come as no surprise to anyone that the royal household, in time of need, should turn to Yorkshire tea.
